It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Resignation] 1818 Jun. 8, Knoxville, Tennessee [to] Joseph McMinn / R. Houton
bibl.author: Houton, R.
bibl.note: This document is the resignation of R. Houton, dated June 8, 1818, and is addressed to the governor of Tennessee, Joseph McMinn. Houton's job, as appointed by the state legislature, was to clear the Tennessee, and Holston rivers in order to make them more navigable.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: I was appointed by the last legislature, one of the managers to superintend the removing the obstructions to the navigation of the rivers Holston & Tennessee (see page 161 late Octs)
I am very desirous that some person be appointed that will attend to the duties as I find it out of my power__ you will therefore consider this as my resignation

closer.add: I am Sir Respectfully your Obt. St Obedient Servant .

R-Houtons Resignations commissioner opening the Rivers__
Governor McMinn Present
